snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes a Google Plus update that provides support for the iPad, ID cards based on Facebook that are only partly a joke...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes a Google Plus update that provides support for the iPad, ID cards based on Facebook that are only partly a joke and a computer system that learns simple games by watching people play them.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: RIM's Jet and Bloomberg's Playlists

snippet: Apple's new iPad will arrive in China on July 20, about four months after its release in the United States. China has become a vital market for the company.
abstract: Apple's new iPad will arrive in China on July 20, about four months after its release in the United States. China has become a vital market for the company.

headline.main: New iPad to Arrive in China This Month

snippet: GroupMe, a mobile messaging start-up, is introducing a way for users to plan and pay for group outings. GroupMe will seed the service with local activities for users to choose from, like a comedy festival in Central Park.
abstract: GroupMe, a mobile messaging start-up, is introducing a way for users to plan and pay for group outings. GroupMe will seed the service with local activities for users to choose from, like a comedy festival in Central Park.

headline.main: GroupMe, a Messaging Start-Up, Rolls Out Group Event Service

snippet: Ouya, a start-up, believes it can challenge the incumbents in the video game console market with less than a million dollars.
abstract: Ouya, a start-up, believes it can challenge the incumbents in the video game console market with less than a million dollars.

headline.main: Start-Up Seeks Funds for $100 Game Consoles to Take on Big Guys

snippet: The sale to Buzzmedia, a portfolio of music and celebrity Web sites, calls into question Spin's future as a print publication.
abstract: The sale to Buzzmedia, a portfolio of music and celebrity Web sites, calls into question Spin's future as a print publication.

headline.main: Spin Magazine Is Sold to Buzzmedia, With Plans to Expand Online Reach

snippet: Top technology and entertainment executives will gather in Sun Valley, Idaho, on Tuesday, the first time they have done so since the debate over two controversial antipiracy bills.
abstract: Top technology and entertainment executives will gather in Sun Valley, Idaho, at an annual conference, the first time they have done so since the debate over two controversial failed antipiracy bills; they will discuss major issues affecting both industries.

headline.main: Tech and Media Elite Are Likely to Debate Piracy
headline.print_headline: Tech and Media Elite Are Likely to Debate Piracy

snippet: A much-publicized study suggesting that a high-protein diet is better for weight loss is just an illusion, as are other diets, one expert says.
abstract: Interview with prominent obesity researcher Dr Jules Hirsch on the findings of a recent, widely-read study in The Journal of the American Medical Association suggesting that people on a high-fat, high-protein diet burn more calories than those eating more carbohydrates.

headline.main: In Dieting, Magic Isn’t a Substitute for Science
headline.print_headline: In Dieting, Magic Isn’t A Substitute For Science

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
